questions.question: numbers-q1
explanations: Correct!
Doubles are positive or negative whole numbers, not text.
Doubles store decimal numbers, not whole numbers.
Doubles in java do not end with an f, floats do.

questions.question: What is an integer called in java?
explanations: Correct!
Some types are shortened in java, such as int for integer.
Primitive types start with a lowercase letter.
Primitive types start with a lowercase letter and are usually shortened.

questions.question: Which of the following is an integer?
explanations: Integers are positive or negative whole numbers, not characters.
Integers do not contain decimals, they are whole numbers. The f at the end of 4.2f makes it a float.
Correct!
Integers do not contain decimals, they are whole numbers.

questions.question: numbers-q2
choices: The code will create an error
explanations: Correct!
Integers have a default value of 0.
Integers have a default value of 0.
Integers have a default value of 0.

questions.question: numbers-q3
choices: The code will create an error
explanations: Doubles store decimal numbers, not whole numbers.
Correct!
Doubles have a default value of 0.0.
Doubles have a default value of 0.0.

questions.question: Declare an integer variable named "myInt" with a value of 4.
Declare an double variable named "myDouble" with a value of 3.14.
Which of the following is a double?
explanations: Doubles are decimal numbers, not text.
The f at the end of 3.4f makes it a float, not a double.
Doubles store decimal numbers, not whole numbers.
Correct!

questions.question: What is the most common type used for storing decimals in java?
explanations: Floats do store decimals, but doubles are more common.
Correct!
Chars store single characters, not decimals.
Integers do not contain decimals, they are whole numbers.
